Description: Lamp fragment with long base. Wheel-made with nozzle added. Pale yellow surface is covered with a red slip. Red-brown Nile silt organic fabric with pale yellow surface. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, large clay pellets, organics (straw?) and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The Red Nile silt fabric resembles that of the Nile Delta, also found at Naukratis. The yellow surface, however, is also a feature of Mareotis silt coarse ware fabrics (caused by salt). No parallels from Egypt, though small lamps with stands have been found in Sicily (Bailey 1975, Q671 and Q672) and Rhodes (Ibid. Q379), dated 4th to early 3rd century BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.039) (Phase 1)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: s. NA 734 (Other Accession Number)
